00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_refs_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_refs_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 
00032 /**
00033  * @file git2/refs.h
00034  * @brief Git reference management routines
00035  * @defgroup git_reference Git reference management routines
00036  * @ingroup Git
00037  * @{
00038  */
00039 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00040 
00041 /**
00042  * Lookup a reference by its name in a repository.
00043  *
00044  * The generated reference is owned by the repository and
00045  * should not be freed by the user.
00046  *
00047  * @param reference_out pointer to the looked-up reference
00048  * @param repo the repository to look up the reference
00049  * @param name the long name for the reference (e.g. HEAD, ref/heads/master, refs/tags/v0.1.0, ...)
00050  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00051  */
00052 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_lookup(git_reference **reference_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name);
00053 
00054 /**
00055  * Create a new symbolic reference.
00056  *
00057  * The reference will be created in the repository and written
00058  * to the disk.
00059  *
00060  * This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
00061  * be free'd by the user.
00062  *
00063  * @param ref_out Pointer to the newly created reference
00064  * @param repo Repository where that reference will live
00065  * @param name The name of the reference
00066  * @param target The target of the reference
00067  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00068  */
00069 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_create_symbolic(git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const char *target);
00070 
00071 /**
00072  * Create a new symbolic reference, overwriting an existing one with
00073  * the same name, if it exists.
00074  *
00075  * If the new reference isn't a symbolic one, any pointers to the old
00076  * reference become invalid.
00077  *
00078  * The reference will be created in the repository and written
00079  * to the disk.
00080  *
00081  * This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
00082  * be free'd by the user.
00083  *
00084  * @param ref_out Pointer to the newly created reference
00085  * @param repo Repository where that reference will live
00086  * @param name The name of the reference
00087  * @param target The target of the reference
00088  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00089  */
00090 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_create_symbolic_f(git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const char *target);
00091 
00092 /**
00093  * Create a new object id reference.
00094  *
00095  * The reference will be created in the repository and written
00096  * to the disk.
00097  *
00098  * This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
00099  * be free'd by the user.
00100  *
00101  * @param ref_out Pointer to the newly created reference
00102  * @param repo Repository where that reference will live
00103  * @param name The name of the reference
00104  * @param id The object id pointed to by the reference.
00105  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00106  */
00107 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_create_oid(git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const git_oid *id);
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * Create a new object id reference, overwriting an existing one with
00111  * the same name, if it exists.
00112  *
00113  * If the new reference isn't an object id one, any pointers to the
00114  * old reference become invalid.
00115  *
00116  * The reference will be created in the repository and written
00117  * to the disk.
00118  *
00119  * This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
00120  * be free'd by the user.
00121  *
00122  * @param ref_out Pointer to the newly created reference
00123  * @param repo Repository where that reference will live
00124  * @param name The name of the reference
00125  * @param id The object id pointed to by the reference.
00126  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00127  */
00128 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_create_oid_f(git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const git_oid *id);
00129 
00130 /**
00131  * Get the OID pointed to by a reference.
00132  * 
00133  * Only available if the reference is direct (i.e. not symbolic)
00134  *
00135  * @param ref The reference
00136  * @return a pointer to the oid if available, NULL otherwise
00137  */
00138 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_reference_oid(git_reference *ref);
00139 
00140 /**
00141  * Get full name to the reference pointed by this reference
00142  * 
00143  * Only available if the reference is symbolic
00144  *
00145  * @param ref The reference
00146  * @return a pointer to the name if available, NULL otherwise
00147  */
00148 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_reference_target(git_reference *ref);
00149 
00150 /**
00151  * Get the type of a reference
00152  *
00153  * Either direct (GIT_REF_OID) or symbolic (GIT_REF_SYMBOLIC)
00154  *
00155  * @param ref The reference
00156  * @return the type
00157  */
00158 GIT_EXTERN(git_rtype) git_reference_type(git_reference *ref);
00159 
00160 /**
00161  * Get the full name of a reference
00162  *
00163  * @param ref The reference
00164  * @return the full name for the ref
00165  */
00166 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_reference_name(git_reference *ref);
00167 
00168 /**
00169  * Resolve a symbolic reference 
00170  *
00171  * Thie method iteratively peels a symbolic reference
00172  * until it resolves to a direct reference to an OID.
00173  *
00174  * If a direct reference is passed as an argument,
00175  * that reference is returned immediately
00176  *
00177  * @param resolved_ref Pointer to the peeled reference
00178  * @param ref The reference
00179  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00180  */
00181 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_resolve(git_reference **resolved_ref, git_reference *ref);
00182 
00183 /**
00184  * Get the repository where a reference resides
00185  *
00186  * @param ref The reference
00187  * @return a pointer to the repo
00188  */
00189 GIT_EXTERN(git_repository *) git_reference_owner(git_reference *ref);
00190 
00191 /**
00192  * Set the symbolic target of a reference.
00193  *
00194  * The reference must be a symbolic reference, otherwise
00195  * this method will fail.
00196  *
00197  * The reference will be automatically updated in
00198  * memory and on disk.
00199  *
00200  * @param ref The reference
00201  * @param target The new target for the reference
00202  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00203  */
00204 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_set_target(git_reference *ref, const char *target);
00205 
00206 /**
00207  * Set the OID target of a reference.
00208  *
00209  * The reference must be a direct reference, otherwise
00210  * this method will fail.
00211  *
00212  * The reference will be automatically updated in
00213  * memory and on disk.
00214  *
00215  * @param ref The reference
00216  * @param target The new target OID for the reference
00217  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00218  */
00219 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_set_oid(git_reference *ref, const git_oid *id);
00220 
00221 /**
00222  * Rename an existing reference
00223  *
00224  * This method works for both direct and symbolic references.
00225  * The new name will be checked for validity and may be
00226  * modified into a normalized form.
00227  *
00228  * The refernece will be immediately renamed in-memory
00229  * and on disk.
00230  *
00231  */
00232 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_rename(git_reference *ref, const char *new_name);
00233 
00234 /**
00235  * Rename an existing reference, overwriting an existing one with the
00236  * same name, if it exists.
00237  *
00238  * This method works for both direct and symbolic references.
00239  * The new name will be checked for validity and may be
00240  * modified into a normalized form.
00241  *
00242  * The refernece will be immediately renamed in-memory
00243  * and on disk.
00244  *
00245  */
00246 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_rename_f(git_reference *ref, const char *new_name);
00247 
00248 /**
00249  * Delete an existing reference
00250  *
00251  * This method works for both direct and symbolic references.
00252  *
00253  * The reference will be immediately removed on disk and from
00254  * memory. The given reference pointer will no longer be valid.
00255  *
00256  */
00257 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_delete(git_reference *ref);
00258 
00259 /**
00260  * Pack all the loose references in the repository
00261  *
00262  * This method will load into the cache all the loose
00263  * references on the repository and update the 
00264  * `packed-refs` file with them.
00265  *
00266  * Once the `packed-refs` file has been written properly,
00267  * the loose references will be removed from disk.
00268  *
00269  * WARNING: calling this method may invalidate any existing
00270  * references previously loaded on the cache.
00271  *
00272  * @param repo Repository where the loose refs will be packed
00273  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00274  */
00275 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_packall(git_repository *repo);
00276 
00277 /**
00278  * Fill a list with all the references that can be found
00279  * in a repository.
00280  *
00281  * The listed references may be filtered by type, or using
00282  * a bitwise OR of several types. Use the magic value
00283  * `GIT_REF_LISTALL` to obtain all references, including
00284  * packed ones.
00285  *
00286  * The string array will be filled with the names of all
00287  * references; these values are owned by the user and
00288  * should be free'd manually when no longer needed, using
00289  * `git_strarray_free`.
00290  *
00291  * @param array Pointer to a git_strarray structure where
00292  *              the reference names will be stored
00293  * @param repo Repository where to find the refs
00294  * @param list_flags Filtering flags for the reference
00295  *              listing.
00296  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00297  */
00298 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_listall(git_strarray *array, git_repository *repo, unsigned int list_flags);
00299 
00300 
00301 /**
00302  * List all the references in the repository, calling a custom
00303  * callback for each one.
00304  *
00305  * The listed references may be filtered by type, or using
00306  * a bitwise OR of several types. Use the magic value
00307  * `GIT_REF_LISTALL` to obtain all references, including
00308  * packed ones.
00309  *
00310  * The `callback` function will be called for each of the references
00311  * in the repository, and will receive the name of the reference and
00312  * the `payload` value passed to this method.
00313  *
00314  * @param repo Repository where to find the refs
00315  * @param list_flags Filtering flags for the reference
00316  *              listing.
00317  * @param callback Function which will be called for every listed ref
00318  * @param payload Additional data to pass to the callback
00319  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00320  */
00321 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_reference_listcb(git_repository *repo, unsigned int list_flags, int (*callback)(const char *, void *), void *payload);
00322 
00323 /** @} */
00324 GIT_END_DECL
00325 #endif
